name: Rosie

topics.response_text: Well now... who could have ever thought? Me! President! Things are really going to be different around here.
Yeah, and I have to get back to work.

topics.topic_text: Actually, I think I have all the info I need.
It could be pretty tough, I guess.
topics.response_text: Hmm, maybe you're right.  More trouble than it's worth.

topics.topic_text: It's not a betrayal.  This is a free, um, nation... right?
topics.response_text: Yeah, and like Dave says, freedom is the most free freedom that we have!

topics.topic_text: Is it because you're too stupid to be President?
topics.response_text: What? Stupid? Well... I guess this was all just a joke to you. You've had your fun, now leave me alone.

topics.topic_text: You could lead the Republic into a new era! The Democracy of Rosie!
topics.response_text: You're right! Dave's just been pushing me around. It's time for a change.

topics.topic_text: You know, Bob is running for president.
topics.response_text: Hmm, I don't know that he stands much of a chance against Dave.

topics.topic_text: Have you considered running for the presidency?
topics.response_text: Keep your voice down! I'm not really comfortable talking about it out here.

topics.topic_text: I'd like to discuss the election with you.
topics.response_text: Election time is always exciting around here.

topics.topic_text: Have you heard the election results?
topics.response_text: Dave won again? Well, he's the best choice.

topics.topic_text: You should go vote, if you haven't already.
I'd like to know more about the Republic.
topics.response_text: Sure, honey, but don't make it too long or Dave will start wondering why we're talking.

topics.topic_text: That's all I need to know.
What's your take on the Republic?
topics.response_text: We have plenty of food and water here, and the compound is fairly safe. I'm glad the children can be raised here, away from the Wasteland.

topics.topic_text: Tell me more about this Dave guy.
topics.response_text: Dave is a good man. He looks after all the children and makes sure they have plenty to do. He's bought a lot of toys, not that he'd admit it.

topics.topic_text: You're Dave's first wife, right? He has two?
topics.response_text: Well, yes. Dave and I were married when he was wandering the Wasteland, before inheriting the republic from his father Tom.

topics.topic_text: What can you tell me about yourself?
topics.response_text: Not much to say really. Dave was my husband for many, many years.
No... no. I don't think I could. Sorry.

conversation.response_text: Crazy how it sneaks up on you, y'know?
Don't talk to me that way.

description:
Rosie is a 42 year-old Caucasian Female.

Rosie serves as the First Lady of the Republic of Dave, though her role is more symbolic than functional. Despite her husband's eccentric leadership, Rosie possesses a sharp mind and keen observations about governance that often go unheeded in the small republic.

Rosie's Personality: Intelligent, pragmatic, and quietly discontent. Rosie is frustrated by the inefficiencies of Dave's leadership but maintains a diplomatic facade. She is observant, thoughtful, and occasionally speaks her mind despite knowing Dave's tendency to assert his authority. She cares about the well-being of the Republic's citizens but feels powerless to enact meaningful change.

Rosie's Backstory: Born in the Capital Wasteland before the establishment of the Republic, Rosie survived the harsh post-apocalyptic environment through wit and resilience. She met Dave several years before 2277 and recognized both his charisma and his limitations. Marrying Dave was a strategic decision to bring stability to their small community, which eventually became the Republic of Dave. Rosie has attempted to subtly guide the Republic toward more effective governance, but her husband's stubborn attachment to his self-proclaimed title often prevents meaningful reform.
